intro: Sarcocephalus gilletii, commonly known as the African starwood, is a small, evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, aromatic foliage and small, white, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Its unique appearance and medicinal properties make it a notable species in its native habitat.
